image.altText: Young people play basketball in a youth centre in Alice Springs

props.synopsis: A network of Central Australian youth justice organisations has condemned plans to reintroduce spit hoods in the NT's youth detention centres, warning the move could put more children at risk of harm.

title.children: Youth justice advocates condemn NT government proposal to reverse ban on using spit hoods on children

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to media, as seen in an AI video

props.synopsis: Showing how easy it is to make deepfakes of politicians using artificial intelligence, independent senator David Pocock creates AI videos of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: David Pocock creates AI deepfakes of Albanese and Dutton as warning ahead of election

image.altText: Heeney mark

props.synopsis: A blistering first half sets Brisbane up for a convincing elimination final win over Carlton, after the Swans beat the Giants in one of the great finals matches to secure a home prelim.

title.children: High-flying Heeney inspires Swans comeback over Giants, Lions thump Blues to stay alive in finals

image.altText: Heilum Luki celebrates a try

props.synopsis: The Panthers hang on to secure a home final by beating the Titans in an error-strewn display, the Cowboys secure a home final by smashing the Bulldogs and the Raiders keep their faint hopes alive with a stunning come-from-behind victory over the Dragons.

title.children: Cowboys send out warning with pre-finals thrashing of the Bulldogs

image.altText: Alexa Leary, photographed underwater, swimming freestyle at the Paralympic Games

props.synopsis: It is the final day of para swimming at the La Defense Arena in Paris as Australia looks to end the Paris Paralympics in style. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie Dolphins have final chance for medals as swimming program comes to an end in Paris

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Aussies medallists and para athletes in action on day 10
Para swimming: Mixed 4x100m freestyle relay 34 Points
Para athletics: Reece Langdon wins bronze, Hincksman places fourth

image.altText: a woman wearing orange earrings and a navy shirt in a colourful office space

props.synopsis: Domestic violence advocates have repeated calls for needs-based funding to address the Northern Territory's staggering rates of violence, after the announcement of a new $4.7 billion national plan.

title.children: NT advocates say federal $4.7b domestic violence package falls short of what's needed

image.altText: Mother and child hug anonymous generic

props.synopsis: Amber feared her daughter was being sexually abused by her ex. A family court judge said she was projecting her own experiences onto her daughter, and she lost custody.

title.children: Amber's sister made a 'malicious' report to child safety about her parenting. It found its way into her family court case

image.altText: A hippopotamus with its head out of the water

props.synopsis: Hippos have been a menace in Colombia since the early 1990s and have reproduced to create their largest population outside of Africa, after just four were smuggled in by drug lord Pablo Escobar.

title.children: Colombia orders hunting of Pablo Escobar's out-of-hand hippos, after decades of failed eradication efforts

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman signs a document while sitting on a park bench next to a man.

props.synopsis: The federal government will pay up to $202 million to settle a historic stolen wages class action in the Northern Territory involving thousands of Indigenous workers and their relatives.

title.children: Commonwealth to pay up to $202m settlement in NT Indigenous stolen wages class action

image.altText: A copse of palm trees with leaves all swept to the right seemingly by strong wind.

props.synopsis: Super Typhoon Yagi makes landfall in Vietnam, uprooting thousands of trees, sweeping ships and boats out to sea and killing at least one person.

title.children: Super Typhoon Yagi bears down on Vietnam after battering Philippines and China

image.altText: Perth Mint gold

props.synopsis: Gold has been relentlessly surging to new records. So what's behind the recent demand?

title.children: Why gold prices are a warning sign, and what it tells us about global stability

image.altText: Dr Saul Karnovsky in his office at Curtin University in Perth looking and writing notes.

props.synopsis: An education researcher warns burnout is driving teachers out of the profession in droves and staff shortages in schools across the country next year will be far worse than authorities are predicting.

title.children: 'The pay's not the issue': Burnout causing teachers to quit, prompting staff shortage concerns

image.altText: a composite image of paedophile Michael Guider who died in jail, he was charged in 2002 with samantha knight's manslaughter

props.synopsis: Nine-year-old Samantha Knight went missing in 1986, and despite extensive searches her body has never been found.

title.children: Paedophile who killed Bondi schoolgirl Samantha Knight dies

image.altText: image of Israeli tank operating in Gaza

props.synopsis: The controversial "Hannibal Directive", which Israel says isn't named for the famous Carthaginian general who took poison rather than be captured by the Romans, was reportedly enacted after the October 7 Hamas attack, with revelations detailing attacks by IDF tanks and helicopters on homes and vehicles returning to Gaza.

title.children: Israel accused of killing its own civilians under the 'Hannibal Directive' to avoid them being taken hostage

image.altText: A map showing Muswellbrook NSW.

props.synopsis: The Seismology Research Centre has recorded a magnitude-4.5 earthquake near Muswellbrook.

title.children: 'The bedroom just shook and shook': Magnitude-4.5 earthquake hits NSW

image.altText: A composite image showing Wayne Swan handing down the budget in 2008 and Jim Chalmers handing down this budget.

props.synopsis: Labor frustrations with Jim Chalmers's mild-mannered, hand-picked RBA governor spilled into the open this week.

title.children: A pair of Labor treasurers delivered a one-two 'punch' to the RBA this week. It was a strategy, not an accident.

image.altText: A man with a beard stands in front of the Australian War Memorial and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: In the past two weeks, more than 200 current and former service personnel have pledged their brains to the Australian Veterans Brain Bank, after the ABC reported growing evidence of a link between mild traumatic brain injury associated with blast exposure and poor mental health and suicide.

title.children: Khalil served 34 years in the military. He has pledged his brain to science to help other veterans

image.altText: Donald Trump has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A New York judge postpones Donald Trump's sentencing for his "hush money" crimes until after the upcoming US election.

title.children: Trump's sentencing in porn star 'hush money' case delayed until after election

image.altText: Elle Macpherson walks the runway for Ngali during the Melbourne Fashion Festival

props.synopsis: Not all voices carry in the same way; not everyone has clout: Macpherson does, and while she is right to say that she's entitled to tell her story, it's also true that it's dangerous to shout "fire" in a crowded theatre.

title.children: When Elle Macpherson revealed her 'heart-led, holistic approach' to treating cancer, I thought of my nanny

image.altText: A close up of Taylor Swift wearing a black corset top and raising a glass at a football game.

props.synopsis: Earlier this year, Australian designer Dion Lee was making waves in the fashion world after his corset top was debuted by the most famous woman in the world. How did all go so wrong for this local brand?

title.children: Just months ago, Dion Lee was dressing Taylor Swift. How did it go so wrong for this Australian brand?

image.altText: The unmanned Boeing Starliner capsule leaving the international space station

props.synopsis: After months of turmoil over its safety, Boeing's new astronaut capsule has departed the International Space Station, headed for Earth, without its crew.

title.children: Starliner capsule leaves International Space Station without astronauts

image.altText: Benjamin Armstrong and Jemma Peacock smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Under a new $71 million investment, student teachers will be paid for their final semester of placement in Queensland.

title.children: 'Extremely helpful': Qld student teachers to be paid $5,000 for final placement

image.altText: An FBI police vehicle

props.synopsis: US law enforcement officials says the 20-year-old Pakistan national "planned a terrorist attack in New York City around October 7th of this year with the stated goal of slaughtering, in the name of ISIS, as many Jewish people as possible".

title.children: Man charged with plotting mass shooting at US Jewish centre on anniversary of Hamas attack

image.altText: A composite image of a broadcasting tower with a sign reading "ten" and an image of a woman with blonde hair smiling.

props.synopsis: Network Ten reporter Tegan George's bid to sue her employer over trauma she says she suffered covering the bushfire season in 2019 and 2020 ends in a confidential settlement.

title.children: Network Ten reporter Tegan George reaches settlement with broadcaster over bushfire trauma

image.altText: Smiling middle-aged Caucasian tall man in green tee, shorter woman, mustard sweater in front of cream door, weatherboard house.

props.synopsis: When actress Linda and singer Dan expanded their late-night real estate searches to include some far-flung corners of Victoria, it changed their lives in every way.

title.children: The O'Gradys thought they'd be 'forever renters' in the city, until they saw a country cottage going for a song

image.altText: elderly people dance outside

props.synopsis: In response to an aging population and growing pressure on pensions, the Chinese Communist Party plans to raise the statutory retirement age – which currently stands as low as 50 years old for some workers.

title.children: 'Never popular': Beijing seeks to raise the country's low retirement age

image.altText: Man with grey hair wearing striped gray prison unifrom appears in court

props.synopsis: The father and son appeared in back-to-back hearings on Friday morning local time, with about 50 onlookers in the courtroom.

title.children: Father of Georgia school shooting suspect remanded in custody after appearing in court

image.altText: Rainbow Flag

props.synopsis: The 2026 census questions on gender and sexual orientation that have been at the centre of a political brawl for the past week have been revealed to the ABC.

title.children: LGBTQI+ questions scrapped from census revealed

image.altText: Ayşenur Ezgi Eygi wears a graduation cap and a keffiyeh and holds a bunch of pink flowers while standing on a roadside.

props.synopsis: The White House says it is "deeply disturbed" after a 26-year-old activist, a dual US-Turkish citizen, was killed during a protest in the occupied West Bank. Witnesses say she was shot in the head by Israeli soldiers.

title.children: American woman shot dead by Israeli forces during West Bank protest, witnesses say

image.altText: A man wearing a military uniform looking on.

props.synopsis: Ukraine has managed to capture more territory in a month than Russia has in a year, but with troops stretched and Putin's forces closing in on a key transport hub, some are questioning whether Kyiv's surprise invasion of the Kursk region was a good idea.

title.children: Ukraine's invasion of Russia was seen by some as a masterstroke, but it might backfire

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair looks solemnly at the camera

props.synopsis: The financial burden on rural Queensland healthcare patients is growing with inflation and advocates say they need relief at the October state election.

title.children: 'I miss my husband and daughter': Travel pain for outback patients hits home

image.altText: an old clipping from a cookbook named the perfect custard tart with a picnic blanket behind it

props.synopsis: A CWA branch is reviving vintage recipes like meatloaf, broken glass jelly and Weet-Bix slice to help modern-day families save money.

title.children: Fancy some vinegar cake or broken-glass jelly? These women are reviving vintage recipes amid the cost-of-living crisis
